utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Blow winds and crack your cheeks! Rage! Blow you cataracts and hurricanes. Spout ‘til you have drenched our steeples, drowned our -

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I know what you’re asking and the answer is yes. Yes, you can take your grandmother and her entire production of King Lear to college with you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going crazy!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Earplugs?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not that. I need something to do. I planned to be at Stanford, but now I’m here … just waiting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about school?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I finished all my credits. All I’m taking this semester is theoretical physics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe this is exactly what you need. A little time off to discover yourself. Travel. Adventure. Go for a little life experience.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s a great idea. I could get an internship. Practical experience in the job market. You know, test the waters?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … that’s not exactly what I was thinking –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: … wind, thunder, fire are my daughters!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Daughters. That’s why King Lear went mad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your timing was perfect. My mother was teaching three acting classes today. In my living room.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. What about her studio?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Flooded. They’re doing the storm from King Lear and things got … out of hand. Remind me to check my insurance.

utterance.speaker: SIRI
utterance.content: Got you covered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie, what do you got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: This is Laura Cambridge, 28. Traffic found her in the passenger seat of the car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She was strangled between the hours of 8 and 10 last night. This bruising here indicates a choke hold. He probably grabbed her from behind with enough force to crush her hyoid bone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He? So there was a witness.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No. But to kill her in one swift move like that the perp had to be taller and heavier than the victim. No signs of sexual assault, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was she strangled in the car?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: CSU didn’t find any signs of any struggle. Looks like her body was dumped here postmortem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose car is it?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not hers. She had a non-driver ID card. Ryan’s running the plates to see if we can find the owner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the purse?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was tossed in the dumpster. Still has cash in it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cell phone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Didn’t find one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What girl in her 20s doesn’t have a cell phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she’s Amish.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I … um… ran those plates off the sedan and uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s from the motor pool at City Hall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: City Hall? Who used it last?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mayor Robert Weldon.

utterance.speaker: MAYOR ROBERT WELDON
utterance.content: We’re all still a little stunned to hear that one of our cars is mixed up in this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me, we’re going to get this all sorted out.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Is that the victim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Laura Cambridge. Do you recognize her, Your Honor?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Uh, my staff would know better, but I don’t believe she’s connected to this office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I’m sorry to have to ask you this, but where were you last night between 8 and 10PM?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: She's one of New York’s finest, huh, Ricky?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s the best.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: So you keep telling me.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I was at a small fundraiser last night with about 50 other people. I’ll – I’ll get you their names.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I appreciate that. And what about the car?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: That was one of several used by my office for the event. Uh, apparently one of my staffers reported it stolen later that night. Off the record? People I was with last night were part of my inner circle. We’re forming an exploratory committee for a possible run at governor. But I’m not anxious to make that public yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll do my best to keep the nature of your business private.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Thanks. I’d hoped you be there, Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fondue night with Alexis. But I did send a check.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Thank you for that. I know that you have a lot more questions, Detective. My chief of staff, Brian Shay, will answer anything else you want to know.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN SHAY
utterance.content: Listen, listen – listen to me, Jack. You’re swinging in the wind on this. But you get me three more votes in the council and I’ll send you a helicopter. You’re the Detective, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: Have a seat. Jordan, we don’t need you in on this.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I’ll leave you guys to work through this. Rick, you want to take a look at our new library initiative? It wouldn’t hurt us to have your endorsement on that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For the New York Public Library? My first love? Anything.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: I’ve already done your leg work, Detective. The car was checked out by Elizabeth Watson, senior director of communication here at the office. When she left last night’s event around midnight she discovered that it was missing. Here’s her statement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With all due respect, Mr. Shay, police investigations are usually conducted by the police.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, unfortunately the 24 hour news cycle moves a hell of a lot faster than you do. And I have to get all my ducks in a row before this thing breaks. It’s my job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And my job is to find Laura’s murderer, so if you don’t mind, and even if you do, I’m going to get my own statement from Ms. Watson about that car. And I’m also going to need statements from all of your staff as to whether they recognize our victim.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: Knock yourself out. But trust me. You’re wasting your time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s my time to waste. Now, I got a job to do.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: So do I. Let me be clear – Mayor Weldon is my priority. And I’m not about to let this thing embolden his opponents and ruin everything that we’ve built.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s right, you know. If this thing gets out and they’re not ready with a response? That’s front page material for weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s front page news either way. If his staff wants to minimize damage, they’ll step back and let me do my job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Step back? These are politicians. They can’t order in a restaurant without two compromises and an ultimatum.

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Beckett? My office?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What did you find out at City Hall?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The staffer that reported the car stolen is accounted for all last night and no one in the mayor’s office seems to recognize our victim.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So her ties to that vehicle could be entirely coincidental.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s entirely possible.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Castle and the Mayor are friends, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: These investigations are like juggling wet dynamite. One misstep and it’ll all blow up in your face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can handle myself.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, that’s good, Detective. Because I won’t be the only one watching.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Politics. And your connection to the mayor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what does it matter? We know he’s not involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s right. You are biased.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m biased? Do you know who Gates voted for in the last election? Because I’m betting it wasn’t Weldon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, where are we on that motor pool?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Verification. The vehicle was checked out at 5 and reported missing shortly after midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it was stolen off the street.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means any connection to the City Hall is entirely coincidental.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan. What do our victim’s phone records show? Any phone calls to City Hall?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No phone calls at all, because Laura Cambridge didn’t own a cell phone. Credit cards haven’t been used in six months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No cell phone and no credit cards? It’s like she’s from another century.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Amish theory is looking pretty good, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It would be nice if it were that easy, but I think something else was going on with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Laura was a Professor of Literature at Hudson University. She was a rising star in her department until six months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened six months ago?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She quit, for no apparent reason. According to her colleagues she also completely cut ties with them. Cancelled her cell phone, cut off her credit cards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No one knows. It’s like something happened to her. After that all I could find were pay stubs for fast food restaurants, a laundry service, and an office cleaning company. It’s like she couldn’t keep a job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She went from professor to janitor? That’s … Good Will Hunting but in reverse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe her family can shed some light.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I tracked down her next of kin. She has a sister. She’s on her way in now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys dig into her life. See if we can find out where she was the night she died. Castle and I will go over to her apartment to find out who she was with.

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Honestly, she pretty much kept to herself. She paid on time. That’s what matters. Unlike those two chuckleheads. Uh, excuse me please, Officer. And uh … gentleman.

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Pipe down, for crying out loud!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An officer and a gentleman? That could be the name of our crime blog.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crime blog? The way you help me write police reports? I got a feeling I’ll be writing that one on my own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doesn’t really seem to be any signs of struggle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no sign of a TV or a computer either. That’s weird, right?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: A bunch of deadbeat tenants in here. You ever get bored, I’m sure I could fill up a bunch of holding cells for ya.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Harvey, when was the last time you saw Laura? Did you see her yesterday?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: During the day. She worked nights. I saw her head to work around … 5.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where she worked?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Some place that paid, that’s all I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you ever see Laura with any friends? Boyfriends?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: No. No. Uh, but I did see a guy leaving here last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was that?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Around 9 … 30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s inside our 8 to 10 murder window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember what he looked like?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Uh … six feet tall. Caucasian. Dark hair.

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA CAMBRIDGE
utterance.content: She never mentioned anyone like that.

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: She wasn’t dating anyone. Thank you. I tried to set her up with a few guys, but she wasn’t interested.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did your sister have any connection to City Hall, or local politics?

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: No, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Were you and your sister close?

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: We used to be. She used to tell me everything, and then … six months ago she stopped calling. She just … dropped out of her life. She gave up her teaching position, she moved out of her apartment on the Upper West Side into that flophouse.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When was the last time you spoke to her?

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: Three days ago. She called for my birthday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: From where? She didn’t have a phone.

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: I don’t know. But she was upset. She said she was in trouble because of something that happened at work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she tell you what?

utterance.speaker: ROBERTA
utterance.content: No. She said it was too dangerous for me to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Laura Cambridge left a tenure track position at a respected university for some flophouse and a mysterious night job that got her into so much trouble she ended up murdered? What the hell was she mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that left her apartment? If he’s our killer he was looking for her. He probably went to her work to find her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means wherever that is it was probably the last place she was seen alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got it. I found out where she works. Her bank statement says she was receiving recent direct deposits from a DAG Corp. Now, I had to dig deep within the city’s business registries, but I found one listing for a DAG Corp between 2nd and 3rd in the Bowery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There it is. Suite 250.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of business do you think this is? Shadowy import export? Money laundering? Sweat shop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shh … shh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD, don’t -!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just an office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where only women work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say it’s about $4.99 a minute. It’s not a sweat shop. It’s a sex shop.

utterance.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh Murry. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN KANE
utterance.content: Laura was one of my favorites. Just a sweet, intelligent, funny girl. She had only been here a few months and already she was one of our most popular goddesses. I can’t believe that she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was she taking calls last night?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: No. No, she took last night off. Said she had something to take care of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Laura told her sister that she was in trouble at work. That something happened.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Nothing happened that I know of. I mean, she did seem distracted the past few days, but that’s about all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, being the Chief … Sexecutive Officer, did you notice any conflicts with her and her colleagues?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Uh, she kept to herself, but she got along well with the other girls. There were no complaints about Laura.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she ever tell you why she was working here?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I just find it odd. She’s a professor with a promising career ahead of her and then all of a sudden she decides to become a phone sex operator.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Maybe she liked it. We get all types here, Detective. Students, actresses, moms. I knew an accountant who did it because she liked the challenge. And it turned her on. It’s a powerful thing to make a client lust for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any chance that one of her clients became obsessed with her?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Oh honey, obsession pays our bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could they have found out her real identity and maybe contacted her?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Absolutely not. No, we keep all of our girls anonymous. Clients can’t be contacted directly. They call one central line and all our calls are routed to each girl by our dispatcher.

utterance.speaker: SARAH MARX
utterance.content: Uh yeah, it’s my job to take the client’s name and credit card information and then route the calls to the girls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s three o’clock in the afternoon. Is it always this busy?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Sure. Some guys need a morning jolt, some guys need an afternoon pick-me-up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone should have told them coffee’s cheaper.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: It’s not just about the sex. That’s the part of this business most people don’t understand. Guys call, girls call … they’re looking for release. Sometimes that release is sexual, but sometimes –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s therapy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … so I’ve been told.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: It’s true. Laura was a successful goddess, not just because of her sexy talk, but because she was a really good listener.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that might have gotten her killed. Sarah, were there any clients that she asked to have blocked?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about problems here at work? Was there anything that she couldn’t tell her boss about?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: No. She … um…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She what? Sarah?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Oh God, I’m so sorry. It’s my fault she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did a client find out who she was?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: No. It was the other way around. Laura came to me about a week ago. She um… she wanted a client’s contact information. I told her it was completely against policy, but she was desperate. She said it was a matter of life or death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re going to need that client’s name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Edgar Navarro?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: I didn’t do nothing. You had no right to drag me out in front of my moms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No? Where were you last night between 8 and 10?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this woman?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: Yeah, look, I don’t know what she told you, but all we did was talk. I didn’t do nothing illegal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how come she’s dead?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that she called you, Edgar, and that the two of you met up.

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: It’s not what you think. She just needed my help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of help could you have given her?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: I learned how to fix computers in prison. And that’s why Laura called me. She needed me to copy some digital recordings for her, from their hard drive. But she didn’t know how to rip them. I told her I needed the file extensions. She said she’d get them and call me from her cell to walk her through it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only she didn’t even own a cell, Edgar.

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: Yes she did. That’s her number right there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you why she needed those files copied?

utterance.speaker: EDGAR
utterance.content: She said she’d heard something on a call. Something she wasn’t supposed to hear. Something bad. She said she needed a copy of it for evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Laura never mentioned a call that upset or concerned her?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: She never said a word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she never asked for copies of recordings?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: No, and I’m the one to ask. This computer room is locked up tight and I’m the only one with a key.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: The lock’s broken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘Kay.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: The hard drive’s gone. All of our calls for the last two months were on that drive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you were in here?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: This morning. Everything was fine. This must have just happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Has anyone visited the office today?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Yeah, a … a man from the gas company. He said there was a leak in the building because of the construction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Uh … about six feet tall, white, dark hair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same guy that was at Laura’s apartment the night she died?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell was on that recording?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever it is, it’s worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So how’s the case of the phone sex gal who knew too much going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s more of a conspiracy thriller. Like The Conversation or uh … Blow Out.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone wants this recording and the secrets on it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Very mysterious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and that’s not the only mystery. Why would a woman, like Laura Cambridge, a highly educated professor, suddenly quit everything and drop out of her life for a series of menial jobs culminating in the wonderful world of phone sex? None of the pieces fit.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Huh. Who called her? I mean, you must be able to trace the call, even though you don’t have the recording, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we have subpoenaed a list of all the incoming lists on Laura’s shifts, but that’s going to be like looking for a needle in a needle stack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. Do you remember me?

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: I called you before. About Detective Beckett’s safety.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I remember.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Once again, Mr. Castle, it seems like we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s the same man who called you about Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s definitely him.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Then the death of this young woman is somehow connected to Beckett’s mother?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It has to be. Otherwise why would he call?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He said there were greater forces at play. That more was at stake than we realized. Clearly this is not just about phone sex. Whatever Laura Cambridge overheard that night, it got someone’s attention. Someone big.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What I don’t get is, what are you supposed to do about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. He gave me a number to contact him, if I needed help. He said I would know when it was time.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mmhmm. You plan to tell Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell her what? ‘Hey Kate, I’ve been taking calls from a shadowy figure who wants to keep you off your mother’s murder case, so they don’t kill you, too'?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. … hold on, wait. What did you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m not eating. Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You’re just in time. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what do we got?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie just called. She said that she found fibers in Laura’s mouth and esophagus. Lab ID’d it as light brown cashmere, which was most likely from our killer’s coat sleeve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Brown cashmere? So we can narrow our suspects down to rich men with impeccable taste.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you saying you’re a suspect?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis is my alibi. What about our gas company worker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, surprise. He doesn’t work for the gas company. And uniforms said that there was no forensic evidence at the Dial-A-Goddess office.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But what we did get from Dial-A-Goddess was their copious call logs – about 200 pages worth. These ladies are busy. I’ve been going through them all morning trying to sort Laura’s calls from the other girls' lines.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are there any calls in there from the Mayor’s office?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thought you said you’re confident that he wasn’t involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just trying to be thorough. And impartial.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. But the private sector is well represented. I’ve got calls from the Met, banks, several high profile brokerage houses – no wonder the economy collapsed, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. What do you got?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. If anything shows up in here as tied to Beckett’s shooting or Johanna Beckett’s murder, would you tell me right away?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait … you guys think this is connected –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not you guys. Beckett doesn’t know and I don’t want her to know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why do you think it’s connected?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just – I just want to cover all my bases, okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys? So uniforms canvassing around Laura’s apartment found a cab that recognized her pic. He said that he dropped her off at the Gotham 11 TV station downtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A television station.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she go to a television station?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would she go into the phone sex business? Why would she do any of these things that she did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, hopefully I’ll get some answers. But first, I ran down that cell number we got from Edgar Navarro. It’s a pay as you go phone. Laura just activated it 6 days ago. She’s hardly used it. She made one call to Edgar and another on the day she died to an agent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A federal agent?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, a book agent. Trevor Hanes.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR HANES
utterance.content: It’s just absurdly tragic. Laura was an incredibly talented writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were her agent.

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: Yeah, we signed her as a client about 6 months ago on the back of an astonishing book proposal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s the book about?

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: It’s a scathing indictment of societal inequity as seen through the lens of the working poor. A sort of contemporary take on how the other half lives. A privileged young woman gives up every comfort to experience life below the poverty line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why she took all those jobs. First hand research.

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: Thing pitches itself, really.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’ll need to see a copy of that manuscript. Her investigations might have led to her death.

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: Well, there isn’t one. At least, not that I’ve seen anyway. Besides, I don’t think she was killed because of her anti-capitalist polemic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: Well, earlier this week she called my office. Said she stumbled across a much more explosive story. A scandal involving a very prominent, very powerful New Yorker. She said it would rock the city to its very foundations.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – what prominent New Yorker?

utterance.speaker: HANES
utterance.content: She wouldn’t say. I just assumed that it was a pitch for her next book. We were going to discuss it this week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m at the Gotham 11 office. There’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is Pat McConnell, Laura’s college buddy. Tell them what you told me.

utterance.speaker: PAT
utterance.content: I – hadn’t seen Laura in years. Just a few days ago she calls me out of the blue. Says she needs to see some raw footages we shot for this research project she’s working on. So I set her up with this edit bay. She was here for over 8 hours. I mean, at one point she even fell asleep. I came by to check on her and she had her eyes closed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Raw footage of what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s all B roll. Of Mayor Weldon. City council meetings, playground openings, backstage at a press conference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A scandal about a prominent, powerful New Yorker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now check out this last tape she was watching.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the Reading Train Foundation. I went to their gala last year.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now look at the girl on the side of the screen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Laura.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s impossible. He said he didn’t know her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look what the Mayor’s wearing. It’s a light brown coat, and it looks like cashmere. That’s just the coat that our killer was wearing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I know this man. I’ve known him 12 years. He’s not a killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, he lied about knowing our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was standing next to her. That doesn’t mean he knew her. Do you know how many people he meets in a day? Expecting him to remember them all, that’s like expecting me to remember everyone that comes to my book signings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re biased.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re damn right I’m biased. Robert Weldon is a good man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even good men make mistakes. He had access to that car. His aide said that he left the event at 9PM. That’s right inside our kill zone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. What’s his motive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. At least not yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then give him a chance. Because the minute you move on him, his career is over.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So … what’s the latest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve got a couple of promising leads. I’m hoping to find something concrete soon.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, anything more on the victim? Anything connecting her back to City Hall?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not yet.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right, Detective. Anything pops, you let me know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Now I’m a liar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I think? I think she’s hoping it’s him. Because if he’s gone, I’m gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you can’t make this one about you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. We have to figure out Weldon’s motive. There’s no way Gates is going to let me subpoena that coat without it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? That’s your takeaway?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you want me to do, Castle? I know that he’s your friend, but I’m sorry. If he killed that girl –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then let me prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything else on that video?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, yeah. When we first saw Laura, she was wearing a volunteer badge for the Reading Train Foundation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She was on staff at the Mayor’s charity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean he knew her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan? You’re with me. Castle, I’m sorry, but you can’t be objective on this one, so I’m going to have to pursue it on my own.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE PARK
utterance.content: No, I don’t know if Mayor Weldon and Laura Cambridge were acquainted. I don’t know much about her at all. She wasn’t here very long.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: Well, we hired Laura as a volunteer, about a week ago. A few days later, we had to fire her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: She was caught copying confidential files.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of files?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: Accounting files.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea why she would be interested in those files?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Park.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: It’s sensitive. I’m not supposed to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Park, a woman was murdered and we are trying to figure out why. You can talk to us here or we can go downtown.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: We recently discovered some discrepancies in our accounts. We found there was some money missing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How much money?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE
utterance.content: $2.3 million dollars. There’s an internal investigation going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This investigation. Does it have anything to do with Mayor Weldon?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you. Attorney General’s office confirms that Mayor Weldon is the subject of the investigation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were looking for motive and here it is. $2.3 million dollars worth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Weldon embezzled from his own charity. Someone must have told Laura about it during one of her sessions and she decided to investigate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once she found enough evidence to expose the Mayor, he killed her to shut her up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You going to tell her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This will destroy Weldon, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And when he’s gone the first thing she’ll do is get rid of Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Are you sure about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir. But the moment I file a warrant request for that coat it becomes public record.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then everyone will know that Mayor Weldon is a person of interest.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, but … What if I’m wrong? It could ruin his career.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We are tasked by the city of New York to protect its people. Sometimes that task comes with a cost. I know what they call me, Detective. ‘Iron Gates.’ I hear the whispers. ‘She’s from IA, she must hate cops.’ Well, the truth is, I love cops. My daddy was a cop. My uncles were cops. But the sergeant who assaulted my patrol partner under the cover of authority? Who holds him accountable? We do. Go to the Mayor. Get him to voluntarily surrender his coat for fiber testing without a warrant. Tell him it’s the only way to keep it out of the media. But if he refuses – you get that warrant and you do your job. Whatever the cost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You going to see Weldon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d like to come with you. I think I can help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think you can.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I heard what you said. I did. And I think I can be a valuable asset. I play poker with the guy. I can tell when he’s bluffing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about if I have to force his hand? Can you be an asset then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I don’t think he did it. But if he did, I want to know. That makes me objective.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN SHAY
utterance.content: Sir, you don’t have to talk to them. It’s my job!

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: It’s okay. I don’t need you to protect me.

utterance.speaker: SHAY
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I haven’t done anything wrong. Please. Thank you. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your Honor, I appreciate you speaking with us.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Well it sounded like I didn’t have a choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The last time we spoke, you said you didn’t know Laura Cambridge.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet, here you are standing next to Laura, a volunteer, at Reading Train.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I – I didn’t recognize her, but in context I remember her. This event was a few nights ago. She was trying to talk to me, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she? Talk to you?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: No, I got pulled away. I had donors I had to speak with. I remember her saying that she wanted to talk to me, but circumstances prevented it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you and Laura never actually spoke.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not even on the phone?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: No. Honestly, after that night I never gave her a second thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, in this photo you’re wearing a light brown cashmere coat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’d like you to turn it over to CSU for testing.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Respectfully, I’m going to have to decline.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Robert, give her the coat. It can only be good for you.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I’m afraid I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with Laura Cambridge’s murder. Or the theft of money from my charity or anything else I’ve been accused of in the last 48 hours. Do you think that any of this is a coincidence?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Robert –

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: No, me here, talking to you? This is exactly what they wanted to have happen. So no, I will not give you my coat. Look, there is a conspiracy against me and I will not voluntarily feed it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What conspiracy?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: Don’t you think it’s funny that all this is happening the moment I consider running for governor? Rick, I’m used to having enemies but this is an organized effort to destroy me. So right now, I don’t trust anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he has good reason to not turn over his coat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, guilt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The conspiracy. Is it so far-fetched? Maybe Laura found out about it and tried to warn him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she and Weldon did talk. She confronted him with what she knew and he killed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. I believe the conspiracy. I mean, I know Weldon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Weldon knows you. Conspiracies, intrigue – that’s your bread and butter. That’s exactly the kind of story that you would respond to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, are you suggesting he’s playing me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m suggesting that you consider the possibility. I have a procedure to follow. He didn’t submit his coat willingly, so I’m going to have to get a court order.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Look, once word gets out that the NYPD subpoenaed his clothing in connection with embezzlement and murder? That man’s career will be over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if he’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Kate, this is politics. Perception is reality. The truth won’t matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What am I supposed to do, Rick? I can’t just stop being a cop because it’s inconvenient.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, just – you can wait. Right? For something else. For another lead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For the coat to disappear? You think I don’t know what’s at stake here? Do you think I actually want to do this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t have a choice.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: My office is cooperating fully with both investigations and I stand here with 100% confidence that a thorough and full investigation will reveal that I am completely innocent of any wrongdoing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You still believe him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You’ve been down this road before, with a friend. You believed Damian Westlake. He’s rotting in prison for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damian and I were kids together. Believing in him was sentiment. My experience tells me Weldon is innocent. My experience tells me there’s something very wrong with this whole situation.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: In that case, maybe it’s time to phone a friend.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Right there, Mr. Castle. That’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know Weldon’s not behind this. That’s why you offered your help. He’s right about the conspiracy, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: He isn’t wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do I do? How do I help him?

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Listen to the evidence. That’s what Laura did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I watched the video of Laura and the Mayor a hundred times. There’s nothing there.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: That’s not what I said, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I met Weldon a few times before this. I liked him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You didn’t set his house on fire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I just threw gasoline on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks for coming. I wasn’t sure that you would, given the way that we left things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t apologize for doing my job, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I would never ask you to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So. Why’d you call me here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I had an epiphany. All this time we’ve been looking for evidence when we should have been listening instead. This all started when Laura told Edgar Navarro she heard something on a call, something she wasn’t supposed to hear. We writers call this the inciting incident. Whomever she spoke to, whatever she heard, is what lead to her murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well what does it matter? I mean, the hard drive is stolen, the recording is gone. We’ll never know what she head on that call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But we might know who she heard it from. You remember how Laura fell asleep watching those B roll tapes at Gotham 11?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was closing her eyes. She wasn’t watching the tapes. She was listening to them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying she was trying to ID our caller’s voce?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had Sarah, our goddess dispatcher, listen to those B roll tapes.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: It’s him, I’m sure of it. He was one of Laura’s regulars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Show her who.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Mayor?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: That guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jordan Norris. Deputy assistant to the Mayor’s chief of staff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Norris, you told us that you didn’t know Laura Cambridge.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet your 80 year old grandmother Greta Markenson did. According to the phone sex records, Laura received numerous phone calls from her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which made Greta look pretty frisky, until we realized that you’d been housesitting at her apartment.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: I – I may have called that service from time to time, but I – I never knew who I was talking to. I mean, how would I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll get to that in a minute. In the meantime, we checked your phone records and you sent this text to a burner cell about a month ago. Now, to most people that would look like a random set of numbers, so we looked into it. Those are actually numbers to a bank account for Mayor Weldon and his charity. Numbers that someone could have used to make it look like the Mayor was embezzling money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man trusted you and you sold him out. So what’d they give you, Jordan? What’d they promise you?

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: I – I thought this was just about the money. I - I didn’t know. I didn’t know they’d try to destroy him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when you found out you betrayed the man you worked for, it ate you up. Didn’t it? So much so that one night, after too many shots of tequila, you called Laura and you let it all spill out. Oh, you didn’t mean to. But she was such a good listener.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: It was anonymous. I was supposed to be safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you weren’t. Because she was a writer and you gave her the story of her life. So she tracked you down. She confronted you. She was going to blow the whistle on you, on your friends. She had to be stopped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We talked to your doorman, Jordan. We know that she visited you that night.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: Okay. She was there. She left after 20 minutes. I – I didn’t kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t have to. All you had to do was call that same burner phone and whoever answered sent a man. A man without a face who choked the life out of Laura Cambridge. And then he broke into her home and her work and he destroyed all of the evidence of everything she knew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose phone was it, Jordan?

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: You don’t understand. These people, they’re more dangerous than you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are looking at 20 years in prison. I am offering you a way out. Now, who did you call?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want a name. Who did you call?

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: Uh … I –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A name, Jordan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Say it.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: Okay. … The person that I called was –

utterance.speaker: BILL MOSS
utterance.content: If it’s all the same to you, I’d prefer my client not be asked any more questions.

utterance.speaker: NORRIS
utterance.content: Your client?

utterance.speaker: MOSS
utterance.content: Mr. Norris, I’m Bill Moss. From now on, please don’t speak to anybody outside my presence. I’ve been retained to represent you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By whom?

utterance.speaker: MOSS
utterance.content: We’re done here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It seems our Mayor will live to fight another day. It seems justice has prevailed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not for Laura Cambridge.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We charged Mr. Norris with criminal facilitation. That’s something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jordan Norris is a pawn. I want the people controlling him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a long game, Kate. Play it piece by piece.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why would you abandon all your plans? You’ve been cleared of all charges?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: You know, for someone who kills off all his characters you have a strange, stubborn streak of optimism in you. But no. I can’t run for governor in 2 years and I can’t run for president in 6. That dream is done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s gotta be something we can do. You’re innocent.

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: A little too innocent. There are people out there - I realize it now – people that control what goes on in the city and beyond. I wouldn’t play ball so they took me out of the game. It’s been decided. This is as far as I get.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what are you going to do now?

utterance.speaker: WELDON
utterance.content: I am going to continue to be an outstanding mayor for the greatest city on Earth.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Why did you contact me, Mr. Castle? The case is resolved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Resolved? How is it resolved? Someone tried to destroy this city’s mayor and I want to know who.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: Trust me when I say it’s not your concern.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is if it involves Beckett or her mother’s murder.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: You’re a writer. Finish this sentence. ‘If Weldon had been run out of office –‘

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d be gone from the 12th Precinct.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: And then who’d keep Beckett from looking into things she shouldn’t? Who’d keep her out of harm’s way?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you did this to protect her? Why?

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: You play chess, Mr. Castle? There are times when a well-placed pawn is more powerful than a king.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have your number if I have to reach you.

utterance.speaker: MYSTERIOUS MAN
utterance.content: You don’t reach me, Mr. Castle. I reach you.
